page.title: 17TOURISM- A FAMOUS HOTEL
page.content: {The Cow and Calf Hotel}stands{850 ft. above sea level, on the top of{Ilkley {Moor.}It was built in{1861}and was converted from{Highfield House}to a {Hotel}in{1900.}It stands opposite the{ {Cow and Calf Rocks,}which give it its name. The building is built out of rocks quarried from a nearby source. The Hotel employs 10 full and part-time staff. It has 18 rooms and up to 34 people can stay there at one time. There is also a public bar called{The Highfield}on the site. Many people visit the Hotel and summer has proven to be the busiest season. These visitors come from all over the world. Our survey showed that in{1981, 20%}of all the visitors came from abroad. Of these about half were{European}and most of the remainder were{Americans.}
